content: cycle of the machine at this point as certain cycles such as the spin cycle can damage the felted item when felting has finished gently ring out excess water by hand and move to dryer on a gentle/low heat cycle pull the bag and handle out when they are both nearly dry but still slightly damp to the touch bag can be shaped at this point by placing it over a large jar or vase or by using hands placed inside bag to slightly stretch it when both bag and handle are fully dry weave the handle through the spaces created by skipping 1 double_crochet when finished use needle and thread to sew both ends together design by shannon johnson 2008
